intro: Anisomeles brevipilosa, commonly known as the short-haired anisomeles, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Anisomeles brevipilosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
